content: {knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-315-01-A |Item_parent=Acute leukaemia |Item_parent_short=Acute leukaemia |Rank=A |Title=Know the criteria defining acute leukemia (AL) |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=1}} A clonal haematopoietic stem cell disease of the bone marrow resulting in proliferation and invasion of the bone marrow by immature, cancerous haematopoietic cells blocked at an early stage of differentiation: blasts. By definition, these blasts represent more than 20% of the cells on cytological examination of the myelogram.

question.question: What percentage of blasts in the bone marrow defines acute leukemia?
